MIME element (text/plain) 
Please find a DMCA Infringemnet notice below as well as details of a TOS

abuse by one of your clients. 
 
The offenders material resolves to NS5.SANZUSHOSTING.COM which upstream 
resolves to EV1Servers.Net 
 
------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- 
 
Formal DMCA Infringement Notification 
 
A. Electronic Signature: Jonathan L. Hawfield : I am authorized to act
on 
behalf of houstonmatrix.net and it's parent owner Houston Matrix, Inc. 
 
B.Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed:

Offending content is located at the following URL: 
http://my-secrets.net/scum.htm 
 
C. houstonmatrix.com and texasmatrix.com are registered domains owned by

Houston Matrix, Inc. a Texas corporation. 
 
http://my-secrets.net/scum.htm 
contains content in violation of said 
copyright. The offending DMCA violation is displayed in a manner to 
interfere with commerce and infringe upon the legal rights protected by 
our copyright. 
 
D.Registrant Contact: 
McGerald, Stoney admin@hbsm-enterprises.com 
HBSM Enterprises 
PO BOX 476 
Bay City, Texas 77404 
United States 
2545264320 Fax -- 2545264320 
 
 
E. I Jonathan L. Hawfield make formal notice that I do not authorize 
offender 
http://my-secrets.net/scum.htm 
to use in whole or part the 
domain houstonmatrix.com or texasmatrix.com  Nor do I authorize the 
offender to display any 
reference to houstonmatrix.com or texasmatrix.com or any content in 
whole or part that were obtained illegally from these entities. 
 
F. Attestment: I Jonathan L. Hawfield attest that the information in
this 
notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that I am 
authorized to act on behalf of houstonmatrix.com and texasmatrix.com 
 
G. I Jonathan L. Hawfield recognize that this formal notification meets 
and or exceeds the formal notification standards and requirements
required 
by the U.S. Copyright Office as outlined below. 
 
-------------------------------------------------- 
Elements of notification. - 
 
(A) To be effective under this subsection, a notification of claimed 
infringement must be a written communication provided to the designated 
agent of a service provider that includes substantially the following: 
 
(i) A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on 
behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed. 
 
(ii) Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been 
infringed, or, if multiple copyrighted works at a single online site are

covered by a single notification, a representative list of such works at

that site. 
 
(iii) Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or

to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or 
access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient

to permit the service provider to locate the material. 
 
(iv) Information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to

contact the complaining party, such as an address, telephone number,
and, 
if available, an electronic mail address at which the complaining party 
may be contacted. 
 
(v) A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that 
use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the

copyright owner, its agent, or the law. 
 
(vi) A statement that the information in the notification is accurate,
and 
under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to
act 
on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly
infringed. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------

 
Jonathan L. Hawfield 
--  
Houston Matrix, Inc. 
P.O. Box 571842 
Houston, TX 77257 
(832)888-4341 Phn.
